name: sprite stops
content:
Sprite stops doing the specified behavior.

(Opens YouTube in new tab)

[How To Make A Sprite](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VUmZ2IsFAGo)


For more information see [`Adding and Removing Behaviors`(#89eba4)](/docs/spritelab/spritelab_adding-and-removing-behaviors/).

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: The phone will “ring” until the person touches and answers it. Use the left arrow to move the person.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: If a sprite is doing multiple behaviors, individual behaviors can still be controlled and stopped. Click on the star to make it stop growing.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group's behavior that is being stopped

tips: - Connect this block to events like [`sprite clicked`(#62fc94)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_spriteClicked/). Code is executed quickly in Sprite Lab. If you tell a sprite to begin a behavior and then tell it to stop in the same sequence of code, there is not enough time to see the behavior in action.
